image.altText: A hand-written letter by a young student about bullying, sitting on a table.

props.synopsis: As federal and state governments devise a plan to address school bullying, a child in Tasmania escapes a distressing case of body-shaming, playground exclusion and cyber bullying.

title.children: Primary school student pleads to leave school after constant bullying

image.altText: Wind farm towers are shown in paddocks in Tasmania

props.synopsis: A 47-turbine wind farm has been approved for Tasmania's central highlands, with the project resulting in a new wind farm noise policy for Tasmania — which opponents say could cast doubt over the entire project.

title.children: Wind farm approved in Tasmania with 'narrow margin' for noise

image.altText: A man holds a placard.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian independent MP who received more than $72,000 in donations from Climate 200 says he will divest his shares in a fossil fuel company, miner and pokies venue operator, as they do not align with his values.

title.children: Progressive politician has shares in mining, pokies

image.altText: Man stands in front of a large drum of cable.

props.synopsis: The $5 billion Marinus Link undersea power cable project to connect Tasmania and Victoria passes two major milestones, with financing locked in and suppliers ordered start production on key components.

title.children: Secured financing locks Marinus Link in, with contractors given go ahead

image.altText: A pair of hangs holding a stethoscope

props.synopsis: The class action involves junior doctors who worked at the Royal Hobart Hospital and the Launceston General Hospital during the past six years.

title.children: Class action seeks to compensate junior doctors for 'excessive' overtime

image.altText: A crowd seen from behind with three people wearing the Australian or Eureka flags as capes.

props.synopsis: A history expert says this Australian National Flag Day there should be pause for concern in the wake of the anti-immigration rallies at the weekend.

title.children: 'Weaponisation' of Australian flag denounced in wake of divisive rallies

image.altText: A woman with dark windswept hair sits on the shore overlooking a rocky beach and waves under a blue sky.

props.synopsis: The mother of one of six children who died in the Tasmanian jumping castle tragedy says she is devastated by a group's attempt to "block" a beachside memorial. They argue the area is "a place for families to escape the hardships of life".

title.children: 'Forced reminder' of jumping castle tragedy opposed by beach users group

image.altText: Two people drag calves by their limbs along an abattoir floor.

props.synopsis: After distressing video was aired showing the shocking treatment of animals inside a Tasmanian abattoir, CCTV cameras were made mandatory. But since then, it has been revealed no record is being kept on whether the surveillance video is being reviewed.

title.children: All Tasmanian abattoirs have CCTV, but it's not known how much footage is watched

image.altText: A young woman wearing black sunglasses speaking at a podium in front of the US Congress Building.

props.synopsis: Numerous survivors of the deceased financier held a press conference on the steps of the US Capitol, urging politicians to vote to release more files into the Epstein investigation.

title.children: Epstein survivors speak out as Congress mulls vote on releasing more files

image.altText: nauru

props.synopsis: The sight of neo-Nazis trying to whip up community anger and recruit new followers drove home to all how criticism of Australia's migration program can lead to and even legitimise hate speech, racism, and violence.

title.children: What's the cost of support for Australia's migration program? $408m and then some

image.altText: Alex de Mianur playing a backhand tennis shot, with one hand, outstretched

props.synopsis: It is heartbreak for Alex de Minaur once again at the US Open, as the Australian fails to break through to the semifinals at a major for the first time in his career.

title.children: De Minaur's QF hoodoo strikes again as Aussie bows out at US Open

image.altText: A hand-written letter by a young student about bullying, sitting on a table.

props.synopsis: As federal and state governments devise a plan to address school bullying, a child in Tasmania escapes a distressing case of body-shaming, playground exclusion and cyber bullying.

title.children: 'Reasons I need to leave': 10yo bully victim lists how nothing is done

image.altText: A couple stand in an apartment looking into camera with a serious expression. One is holding a cat.

props.synopsis: A year after they moved into an "affordable" apartment in a new public-private housing development in inner Melbourne, Alix and Tiarn were told their rent would increase by 17 per cent. They say their experience highlights flaws in the model the Victorian government is using to redevelop its aging public housing towers.

title.children: Tenants say Victorian affordable housing scheme is flawed

image.altText: A bunch of signs on a beach saying "Our ocean is not a dump".

props.synopsis: Ex-HMAS Adelaide was sunk in 2011, 1.8 kilometres off the shoreline of Avoca Beach — a well-known surf break less than 2 hours north of Sydney.

title.children: Defence gifted NSW a warship. It's now corroding on the seafloor

image.altText: Jasveen Sangha wearing a GUCCI t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Sangha is the last of the five suspects charged in the case to plead guilty rather than stand trial.

title.children: 'Ketamine Queen' pleads guilty in Matthew Perry's drug death

image.altText: A boy with only one hand holds up a rose as he wears a sling around his neck. Other children aroung him also hold roses

props.synopsis: A UN committee says at least 21,000 children in Gaza have been left with disabilities since the war between Israel and Hamas began on October 7, 2023.

title.children: UN says Gaza war has left at least 21,000 children with disabilities

image.altText: A car with a bullet-ridden windshield sits with tape around it as people look at it in a carpark

props.synopsis: The terror group said it was behind a bomb that went off in Balochistan province, killing 15 people.

title.children: Islamic State claims responsibility for deadly bombing in Pakistan

image.altText: Nick Daicos of the Magpies tries to get through Jordan Dawson and Wayne Milera of the Crows

props.synopsis: With a cohesive and suffocating defence, the Adelaide Crows have the tools to put the ghosts of 2017 behind them and reach the top of the AFL mountain.

title.children: Adelaide's AFL finals drought is over, and defence has them set for success

image.altText: A man and woman stand side-by-side looking at the camera standing in front of a grey stone building

props.synopsis: Pari Island residents have flown to Europe to state their case in Switzerland, as their Indonesian homes are ravaged by the impacts of climate change.

title.children: Tiny island takes on cement giant in 'David vs Goliath' climate change battle

image.altText: A learner driver symbol on the windscreen of a car

props.synopsis: Pressure is mounting on the federal government to lead a national push to stop learner drivers from being sexually harassed and assaulted by their instructors.

title.children: 'Appalling' alleged sexual assaults of learner drivers sparks political response

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie talks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Former Victorian premier Dan Andrews caused a stir in China but former NSW premier Bob Carr has tried to distance himself from any closeness to Vladimir Putin.

title.children: 'Would have avoided them': Carr's post photo advice for Andrews

image.altText: Angela Rayner getting out of a car in Number 10 Downing Street.

props.synopsis: Angela Rayner, who is considered one of the potential successors to Prime Minister Keir Starmer, says she is "devastated" after learning she underpaid stamp duty on the purchase of a beachside flat.

title.children: UK deputy PM faces calls to quit after underpaying tax on seaside flat

image.altText: Bangor building

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway after a young child went missing from a childcare centre in Sydney's south for several hours on Tuesday, in an incident the acting education minister has called "unacceptable".

title.children: Toddler missing for hours after grandparent picked up wrong child

image.altText: A dead fish on a river bank

props.synopsis: The Anglesea River — a tourism drawcard on the Surf Coast and place of pride for locals — has seen repeat fish kills in recent years, with both residents and experts at a loss as to restore the river's health.

title.children: The neon green river killing fish on Victoria's surf coast

image.altText: Richard Scolyer wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer made the comments next to the prime minister after a position at Chris O'Brien Lifehouse was named after him.

title.children: Richard Scolyer says brain cancer battle 'getting closer' to an 'end point'

image.altText: Chloe Malle wearing an off-white sparkly dress with capped sleeves, a v-neckline and flower details

props.synopsis: Chloe Malle's mother Candice Bergen played a Vogue editor on Sex and the City. Now she's taking over from Anna Wintour.

title.children: How a 'proud nepo baby' will change the face of Vogue

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price standing and smiling.

props.synopsis: Labor this week announced its permanent migration target would not change from 185,000 in this financial year, attracting criticism from the opposition, which wants to see it lowered.

title.children: Liberal senator admits Labor migration vote-stacking claims a 'mistake'

image.altText: A man wearing a suit stands at the dispatch box in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: After enduring a week of pressure over its delays to aged care reforms, the government has struck a deal with the Coalition to bring funding for home care packages forward.

title.children: Labor to fund extra 20,000 home care packages after political pressure

image.altText: Albanese water

props.synopsis: The government will argue the "proper functioning" of government is hampered by disclosure laws and push for wide-ranging restrictions on the information that can be released to the public.

title.children: Labor push to water down information laws, reduce transparency

image.altText: Man walking from court.

props.synopsis: Newcastle man Jarrod Scifleet pleads guilty to possessing child abuse material, bestiality videos and illegal gel blasters, following a two-year investigation sparked by a tip-off from the federal police.

title.children: Bestiality videos and 34,000 child abuse images found on 24yo's devices

image.altText: A close-up of the face of a greyish-brown elephant seal lounging in shallow water.

props.synopsis: Sammy the seal often pops up in the seaside Victorian town of Portland and has recently been photographed munching on a shark. He is loved by many, but authorities are warning people to keep their distance.

title.children: Shark-eating seal returns to Portland, prompting warnings for admirers

image.altText: Pro-Palestinian protester cross Sydney Harbour Bridge with people with flags, signs and umbrellas

props.synopsis: Police say the demonstration, scheduled for September 13, is being organised by an umbrella group known as Australia Unites Against Government Corruption.

title.children: Anti-vaxxers, sovereign citizens plan Sydney Harbour Bridge protest

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Police say the 32-year-old, who was already on bail for separate charges, poses an unacceptable risk to the community.

title.children: Neo-Nazi to face bail decision on Friday after arrest over alleged attack

image.altText: Caucasian man with a fair complexion with reddish /sandy hair and bluish-green eyes

props.synopsis: Remains found at Maidenwell in Queensland's South Burnett region are yet to be formally identified, but investigators have been in contact with Andrew Burow's family.

title.children: Police find human remains believed to be missing man

image.altText: Crows player Izak Rankine in casual clothes.

props.synopsis: Adelaide Crows head coach Matthew Nicks has said suspended star Izak Rankine is "in a pretty good space" following his return to the club after an overseas break.

title.children: Rankine addresses Crows teammates after returning from overseas break
